verses.verse: Moreover, <S%H5375><s%> take up a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for the princes <S%H5387><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%>

and say, <S%H559><s%> What was your mother? <S%H517><s%> A lioness: <S%H3833><s%> she couched <S%H7257><s%> among lions, <S%H738><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the young lions <S%H3715><s%> she nourished <S%H7235><s%> her cubs. <S%H1482><s%>

She brought up <S%H5927><s%> one <S%H259><s%> of her cubs: <S%H1482><s%> he became a young lion, <S%H3715><s%> and he learned <S%H3925><s%> to catch <S%H2963><s%> the prey; <S%H2964><s%> he devoured <S%H398><s%> men. <S%H120><s%>

The nations <S%H1471><s%> also heard <S%H8085><s%> of him; <S%H8610><s%> he was taken in their pit; <S%H7845><s%> and they brought <S%H935><s%> him with hooks <S%H2397><s%> to the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Now when she saw <S%H7200><s%> that she had waited, <S%H3176><s%> and her hope <S%H8615><s%> was lost, <S%H6><s%> then she took <S%H3947><s%> another <S%H259><s%> of her cubs, <S%H1482><s%> and made <S%H7760><s%> him a young lion. <S%H3715><s%>

He went up and down <S%H1980><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the lions; <S%H738><s%> he became a young lion, <S%H3715><s%> and he learned <S%H3925><s%> to catch <S%H2963><s%> the prey; <S%H2964><s%> he devoured <S%H398><s%> men. <S%H120><s%>

He knew <S%H3045><s%> their palaces, <S%H490><s%> and laid waste <S%H2717><s%> their cities; <S%H5892><s%> and the land <S%H776><s%> was desolate, <S%H3456><s%> and its fullness, <S%H4393><s%> because of the noise <S%H6963><s%> of his roaring. <S%H7581><s%>

Then the nations <S%H1471><s%> set <S%H5414><s%> against him on every side <S%H5439><s%> from the provinces; <S%H4082><s%> and they spread <S%H6566><s%> their net <S%H7568><s%> over him; <S%H8610><s%> he was taken in their pit. <S%H7845><s%>

They put <S%H5414><s%> him in a cage <S%H5474><s%> with hooks, <S%H2397><s%> and brought <S%H935><s%> him to the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon; <S%H894><s%> they brought <S%H935><s%> him into strongholds, <S%H4685><s%> that his voice <S%H6963><s%> should no more be heard <S%H8085><s%> on the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Your mother <S%H517><s%> was like a vine, <S%H1612><s%> in your blood, <S%H1818><s%> planted <S%H8362><s%> by the waters: <S%H4325><s%> it was fruitful <S%H6509><s%> and full of branches <S%H6058><s%> by reason of many <S%H7227><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%>

It had strong <S%H5797><s%> rods <S%H4294><s%> for the scepters <S%H7626><s%> of those who bore rule, <S%H4910><s%> and their stature <S%H6967><s%> was exalted <S%H1361><s%> among the thick boughs, <S%H5688><s%> and they were seen <S%H7200><s%> in their height <S%H1363><s%> with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of their branches. <S%H1808><s%>

But it was plucked up <S%H5428><s%> in fury, <S%H2534><s%> it was cast down <S%H7993><s%> to the ground, <S%H776><s%> and the east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> dried up <S%H3001><s%> its fruit: <S%H6529><s%> its strong <S%H5797><s%> rods <S%H4294><s%> were broken <S%H6561><s%> off and withered; <S%H3001><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> consumed them. <S%H398><s%>
Now it is planted <S%H8362><s%> in the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> in a dry <S%H6723><s%> and thirsty <S%H6772><s%> land. <S%H776><s%>

Fire <S%H784><s%> is gone out <S%H3318><s%> of the rods <S%H4294><s%> of its branches, <S%H905><s%> it has devoured <S%H398><s%> its fruit, <S%H6529><s%> so that there is in it no strong <S%H5797><s%> rod <S%H4294><s%> to be a scepter <S%H7626><s%> to rule. <S%H4910><s%> This is a lamentation, <S%H7015><s%> and shall be for a lamentation. <S%H7015><s%>
